snippet: The government’s longtime firewall had forced Iranians to use special software to access the sites, and it was unclear whether the opening Monday was the result of an official decision or a glitch.
abstract: Internet users in Iran are surprised to find that they can access Facebook and Twitter without having to evade the government's firewall, which had blocked direct access to the sites for years; it is not immediately clear whether the government has made an official decision to stop blocking the sites.
lead_paragraph: The government’s longtime firewall had forced Iranians to use special software to access the sites, and it was unclear whether the opening Monday was the result of an official decision or a glitch.

headline.main: Iranians Gain Access to Facebook and Twitter
headline.print_headline:
Firewall Falls
For Iranians
On Social Sites
